bow: to plug or not to plug hi mommit just few weeks from officially joining your ranks so my concerns are starting to move from pregnancy to motherhood pretty experienced with babies and kids and have lot of family support especially my mom she ll be down the whole month of december to help me out however we re having conflict over pacifiers my reading and thinking has led me to the conclusion that like to avoid them if possible and if not limit their use plan to exclusively breastfeed and know that pacifiers have been associated with some difficulty getting good pattern established ear infections dental problems etc all seem like good reasons not to plug not judging anyone decisions here know that no plan survives contact with the enemy and am well aware that at 3am when have slept for week that pacifier might be just what need but my plan is to not use pacifiers really like to avoid using them until breastfeeding is well established at least and then wean her from them before she year old my mother basically says being silly that pacifiers are awesome for self soothing and giving mom break and that the benefits outweigh the risks tl dr ve read the articles and the books what really like is feedback from you did you use pacifier is there *anyone* who did what are your experiences with weaning from them *am* being silly thanks we caved at about week old because my son would not sleep we weaned him to only naps and nighttime when he turned did seem to affect his nursing thank you did he have any problems with ear infections surprisingly not had them all the time but he has had two in his whole existence haha we only used pacifier with our son when he was cutting his first teeth he never really took to one even in the hospital you can use them for especially hard times without making it habit you might want to make that clear to your nurses if you give birth in hospital no pacifiers ours had soothies on hand and gave one to my son in the nicu was planning on using them unless he was super fussy baby but it surprised me that was even asked thank you know sometimes they re just so easy to use and can keep me sane nice to know that its possible to have them used occasionally good to know about the nurses its in our birth plan but it sounds like its second nature for them to just pop one in their mouth we re at hospital that supports rooming in so unless there health issue she ll be in the room with me if she has to go to the nicu we ll try to remember to pin note to her we used one for months with our first amp we re using one now with our week old pump milk for our baby because his latch was evil even before the pacifier what was weaning your first from it like my mom said that at under year the baby wo understand and it will just be more difficult used pacifier when my girl was days old also breastfed and there was no confusion or issue at all however all babies are different see how it goes you might be blessed with little angel who sleeps peacefully and may not need pacifier but just wanted to let you know that we did experience any issues at all breastfeeding and using one congrats and hope everything goes well with the rest of the pregnancy xo thanks good to know the two can work together am worried going to have problems breastfeeding so do want to risk anything getting in the way no particular reason just do know lot of women that have made it last know that ultimately we ll make the decision in the moment just like to be prepared you re wise to ask the question all babies are different while my daughter did confuse the nipple for the pacifier and had no issue others may as side note wish you the best of luck with breastfeeding read every book on the topic and was fully prepared for huge struggle and amazingly my girl latched on like pro right from the start and it never hurt one bit you might get chapped nipples at first and if you do this product http www motherlove com product 1001 nipple cream html is wonderful and will help you heal quickly good luck plan to wait until we ve got bit of confidence on breastfeeding before introducing plug if we do decide to for whatever reason ve read lot about breastfeeding and watched videos subscribed to breastfeeding just worried about it first off make sure that your mother does undermine you no matter what you decide you are responsible for the baby and she is helping you not the other way around as far as my own experiences go was planning on waiting the recommended weeks before introducing pacifier to my twins so we all could firmly establish breastfeeding think we lasted or days before giving in for the record they are both breastfeeding like champs knowing when to compromise is part of parenting ve read some of the studies regarding ear infections and the study that found the strongest link specifically found that pacifier use in the first 10 months is fine and does increase the rate of ear infections in babies that young but they strongly suggest weaning the baby off pacifiers after 10 months of age do forget that pacifiers can prevent sids also babies love to suck would you prefer for your baby to suck on pacifier or his hands finger and thumb sucking can cause mouth formation problems as well as pacifiers and you ca take his thumb away have seen kids that finger suck well into puberty whereas ve never seen twelve year old with pacifier as far as concerned the only real drawbacks of pacifiers are that they can mask hunger cues and if you are feeding on demand that can be problem also if the baby is not weaned off of them by the time they learn to speak they can cause speech impediments there are issues that sticking to my guns on and issues that flexible on the key is to know when it worth the fight edit it might be worth your time to look into different types of pacifiers some claim to be breastfeeding friendly because the shape of the nipple we use pacifier and breastfed for 16 months my pediatrician told us that as long as baby has good latch before introducing pacifier there should be any nipple confusion my baby wo take pacifier or bottle she knows which is the nipple and which is the fake crap and wo settle for anything less than mum it can be trying at times because it difficult being her one main source of comfort sucking as well as the feeding station so my advice is if you are going to introduce the pacifier or bottle for that matter do it sooner rather than later nipple confusion be damned there are ways to help baby through nipple confusion there is no way to make baby drink from bottle or take pacifier if they do want to this may well help you save your sanity and not feel resentful at being the only one who can soothe your baby at 3am we never had any problems with breastfeeding you are much much more likely to get through the first couple of months and any problems that come up after that if you have good lactation consultant check with your hospital the one where my daughter was born provided consulting for free they can help you through just about any problem you re likely to have and it wonderful to be able to check how much you re producing they weigh the baby before and after because pumping does necessarily give you the same amount and to go in for little pep talk do wish though that we gotten rid of the pacifier when she did seem terribly attached to it when if we forgot to give it to her she would get upset because when we did forget months later just after she turned she pitch fit but very glad we had it during the first year consider this they *need* to suck pacifier is mom substitute no pacifier you ca step away while baby is in sucking mode thanks from the responses getting so far it sounds like this is very individual to baby thing that the reasoning my mom has mentioned that if we do introduce the plug early the baby will never take it like her to take bottle too so that my husband can help feed her thanks for the feedback thank you how was the weaning experience did you wean from both at the same time thanks for the in depth response my mom should be too bad she just has lot of opinions and for some reason this one about the pacifiers is particularly strong one like said know the plan is to wait but know it might not work out that way wow you re breastfeeding twins too that very encouraging read about the sids connection too but forgotten that compelling reason to introduce the pacifier after breastfeeding is established and then wean before year my mother pointed out the hand sucking vs pacifier thing too guess if we can successfully wean before she year old there are some benefits there lot of good stuff here to think about thank you ve bought bottles that have breastfeeding friendly nipples did realize there were pacifiers with the same design thanks thanks have doula and plan to connect with the local lll hopefully the hospital has consultant too my mom breastfed all of her kids too and my husband is very supportive not working for the first 12 weeks either it sounds like weaning before year might help with lot of that attachment issue maybe we ll only use it during nap time nighttime hopefully breastfeeding is established easy and wo have to worry about it exactly know that every baby is different but think going into it with the mindset that bink was more of last resort helped if he was unhappy we went down the list is he hungry diaper clean does he want snuggles not too hot or cold nothing crazy going on around him does want to play or read or hear song ok try bink if it worked great he just did get used to always having it oh forgot to mention that he was bottle fed latching issues from the start doubt if the bink had anything to do with it though he was born at 33 weeks via emergency section got knocked out and did get to even hold him for almost day boo hope you get to have your original plan am still kinda angsty that mine did work out on several levels that good advice thank you sorry your birth was all you wanted that must have been really tough to have it work out that way sounds like he did pretty good for being so early though its crazy to think that she *person* in there and could survive without me my first refused all pacifiers wasted so much money on them never sucked her thumb and comfort nursed lot she was slow gainer so it was probably for the best that she never took one cause never had to deal with weaning kid off one we were not planning on introducing one to our second at weeks we did though she had reflux would not comfort nurse actually hated nursing at times from pain our ped said to try paci as some kids respond well to it and it may control the reflux without daily meds was nervous did really want to have worry about weaning her off it do want to be stressed over weaning well she would not take one we tried 10 different brands finally she liked one avent orthodontic silicone and it helped her reflux within days what change almost no forceful spit up anymore arching and crying while eating and she liked nursing again marvelous we always tried to comfort her without it first or offered breast to make sure she was not hungry but if that did not work we gave the paci also after she fell asleep and was in deep sleep we took it out about month ago during teething she refused to take it decided she hated it and weaned herself off she must have grown out of the reflux as well which usually happens between months there is no issues there she does not suck her thumb either has not increased her nursing sessions at all it was very good tool for us to use she is months on saturday think it does have to do with the personality of kids some love the paci and some just don personally would loved to not have had to use it but it was really needed if you do end up using one make sure babe is gaining well try other soothing first nursing walking etc and if that does not work then give the paci good luck and stay open to the idea just in case you can get on the forums www llli org now if you have any questions about pregnancy child birth and breast feeding it is nice mom to mom you can ask questions and lot of moms have btdt lots of encouragement and support it is nice too if you ca get to meeting always forgot to go went into parenthood thinking no never give my kid paci boy was wrong even though was exclusively breastfeeding and know babies should do most of their comfort sucking at the breast it just did work out for us my son loves to comfort suck in the first few weeks he was at the breast almost 24 felt like human pacifier then then one day he freaked out he was comfort nursing and all of sudden stopped he pulled off but would latch back on only to pull off again and wail this happened over and over again had no clue why finally gave him my finger and he was so happy and immediately fell asleep after many days of this happening over and over again learned my lo hates getting even the smallest amount of milk while comfort sucking that why he loved sucking in my finger instead of course he could always have my finger so gave in and got him paci it used only for sleep now when he wants to suck the most was starting to hate breastfeeding because of how much he wanted to just suck now still happily breast feed and he gets his comfort sucking on and we are both happy there has been no issues with nipple confussion he is very aware which nipple is which eventually ll take the paci away and hopefully it is too hard think it depends on how baby is and how mama is as well maybe you ll get lucky and have baby who does even want the paci having plan is good just doesnt always go the way you planned ve been giving my son binky since he was two days old and he is also ebf and does have any issues and if did he would be able to soothe himself poor kid has the sucking need of shop vac we actually wanted my son to use pacifier to help with his reflux but he never took to them he never really had strong need to suck either he loves them now as teething toys though thanks for the info on pacifiers and ear infections with regards to the first ten months vs after had heard that before do you remember which studies you looked at alright let me start with saying really have no business being here at all as am not mother and know minimal amount about raising babies however am currently college student who has been dealing with some dental issues which *may* have been caused from using pacifier have tmj which is disorder having to do with the jaw and surrounding muscles grind my teeth at night which is probably caused by related to the fact that most of the time during the day create suction in my mouth with my tongue as if were sucking on pacifier or thumb now have no evidence this habit which am currently trying to break but with little success is from using pacifier as baby and even if did would never blame my parents for using one as realize there are few other options when baby wo stop screaming but just wanted to say that you are definitely not crazy for at least considering this dilemma my suggestion use it as needed but do abuse it on my phone breastfeeding but ll try here it is http www ncbi nlm nih gov pubmed 7478830 i=3 amp from= 8056494 related we had an interesting time with binkies and our baby girl the first few weeks we skipped them altogether we were having latching issues due to edema and positioning because of my breast size however we quickly found that binky would calm her down when she was in the carseat but she could keep the right suction on it so we would gasp horror use burp cloth to hold it in for her while she relaxed this was with the orthodontic style the lactation consultant we had suggested switching to the soothie type binky where the nipple is more of column because it mimics mom and keeps her tongue used to curling around the nipple rather than pushing against it same issue we help her with cloth then once she was calm remove it and let the binky fall out we eventually stopped trying when she started moving her head lot the cloth no longer helped she just does use binky at all she still has them around spent good money on the things but they are more toys than pacifiers now side note we wound up doing hybrid breastfeeding formula thing because just could match her demand for milk pondered quitting bf ing altogether but did want to give it up enjoy it too much so there no nipple confusion just no preference for binkies you are right each baby is different and it all comes down to you you will know your baby best you are mommy keep an open mind if you decide to try to wait on pacifiers then do it but do get down on yourself if you ca hang finding that parenting has got to be flexible in the end happy baby an happy mommy is all you are looking for ve been using pacifier with my second for weeks she weeks old now she really liked to suck and both our lactation consultant and our pediatrician said that at week when my nipples killed and hated the sound of the baby crying because her comfort sucking hurt so muh to use the bink to give my breasts break that being said she had an awesome latch right from the get go knew we were going to have trouble getting it right once got over the initial pain also my pediatrician told me at the month appointment that they the aap no longer advise against waiting to use pacifier did check into it another option that got old real fast was offering finger but then your tied to baby in an odd and uncomfortable position we used pacifier with my son too and had difficult ish time giving it up and at his first dentist appointment the dentist knew before told her that he had used one but at the second appointment when we had been bink free for year she said that his teeth were perfectly normal so no lasting effects bottom line buy one or two and hide them it not good to make decisions when you re desperate and exhausted but then again if they can help with the desperate and exhausted feeling it might be worth it best of luck you re awesome thanks my firstborn is pacifier using baby my baby does like them both have pros and cons firstborn had pacifier when crying without any reason we found and for sleeping for the first couple of months then when nearing first birthday we gave him the pacifier much more often and shortly after first birthday only for sleeping and sometimes in the car around second birthday he discontinued use at home but for napping at daycare still uses one and now around third birthday wants to use pacifier again think mostly for show baby used one for couple of times as young baby but dislikes them along with bottles sippy cups any silicone so you may deide for your baby if she ll use pacifier but she may decide the other way as with many many decisions pros on being pacifier less one thing less to worry about taking wherever you go no tedious weaning off the pacifier no nightly searches for the pacifier cons on being pacifier less no easy pop paci in to shut up for minute this is apreciated when in the car or tending other immediate needs here it would be tending toddlers need if baby took one maybe harder time of introducing bottles sippy cups maybe harder time getting to sleep by herself nurse pop in paci steal away is bit harder without paci edit when you should decide on using pacifier pretend to not understand your daughter whenever she talks with pacifier in her mouth and tell her you do understand her because of the pacifier this worked really well with our firstborn and talking with pacifier is generally bad habit also planned not to use pacifiers but within the first couple of weeks my son started sucking his thumb thumb sucking is **much** harder habit to break so we started giving him pacifier to soothe him he only gets it if he needs help calming down ex fell and bumped his head or when he going to sleep never had any pacifier related problems with breast feeding after his birthday we plan to start weaning him off of it have children and only one of them would take pacifier all were breastfed in my experience it did cause any interference but did wait little while to introduce it the main reason as understand it for delaying pacifier introduction is establishing supply frequent nursing in the early days is important to establish good supply however did personally experience any supply issues with my baby who took the pacifier so do know every baby is different every mom is different find what feels right and works for you and your family and go with it we did the burp cloth thing too glad to know we are the only ones nipple friendly pacifiers have worked for us the long ones not the flattened out mouth filler ones she had one from day one and never had problem with latch because she refused to latch at all ever but my daughter only took one for about months she was never attached or needed to have it when she was upset she take it if she wanted it but if not oh well she would only take one kind and one day could find any of the she had so went to go get more the store was out of her kind so got the most similar shaped pacifier they had came home tried it out she would take it after two days of trying to get her to take paci that was her favorite and then trying the ones she liked after finding them she refused it all together she has had one since at about 5months she started sucking her thumb when she gets tired thanks for the insight varied experiences from moms is what wanted so have broad idea of what we might expect have few plugs around the house so they re available if for some reason we decide its needed thanks had really considered them as teething toys thanks my mom scoffed when mentioned the nipple confusion breastfeeding issues but it comes up all the time in the readings thanks for the insight thanks for the good advice as long as we ve established breastfeeding well ll be more comfortable giving her plug its been pointed out that it helps prevent sids and can help with teething as well as the soothing so if it seems like the right choice so be it trying to keep an open mind about parenting still on the side of things where can say ll never do that lol know that all about to change we used pacifier starting when he was few days old wanted to avoid it but this kid seriously wanted to suck all the time and my nipples were damaged to the point of bleeding he was piranha he latch well suck for while then unlatch and chomp he started getting the paci when he was fed but still wanted to nom on something he months old now still ebf and still uses paci it not like we stick it in for no reason if he gassy he ll overeat to the point of puking over and over but he still wants to suck if he in the car ca very well give him my boob sometimes he just little grumpy and wants to suck on something and stare at the world the thing you have to watch out for with pacifier is other people giving the pacifier for no reason you do need to plug the kid when you have an otherwise content baby on your hands my so parents would stick the pacifier in for no reason even after we explained not to use the pacifier until after he fed changed has absolutely no reason to be crying and clearly just wants to suck my son refuses the pacifier about half the time he would much rather be on the boob thanks for the advice that interesting about the dentist it sounds like most babies do have any issue with breastfeeding and pacifiers we ll just make sure pacifiers are used after breastfeeding is good to go and as last resort thanks good advice ll be saving this thread for sure thanks that sounds like good compromise if we can use the pacifier as limited tool and not default condition ll be lot more comfortable with it thanks that is my understanding as well my mom said that if we do introduce the pacifier early the baby wo ever take to it it does sound like that the case thanks for the feedback thanks that great point about not having other people stick it in one poster already pointed out that nurses at the hospital will do this as default soothing technique last resort only that exactly how feel always hate seeing little kids who constantly have pacifier in their mouths nothing against parents who choose to use pacifiers all the time just personal preference was vehemently against pacifiers prior to having my son my story is exactly normal but my son was born following just over minute of shoulder dystocia he was unresponsive and unable to breathe on his own following intubation and three days of intensive coolcap therapy cooling of the brain to prevent swelling he lost his instinctive ability to suck when at one week we were finally able to start feeding him via nasogastric tube would shove that pacifier in his mouth and would use all of my will to get him to suck it it was long process few days later we tried bottle and eventually moved to the breast he was actually natural breastfeeder since then he months now have wanted him to take pacifier so many times usually at 3am but he refused now of course glad he is pacifier baby anyway just wanted to share that despite whatever you think now your circumstances will ultimately impact your final decisions it sounds like you re already expecting the unexpected so just go with the flow it ok if things do go as planned just going to add my limited experience do know if it decision you really need to make since you can just follow your baby lead if you re not outright opposed waited until weeks old to offer pacifier after she had established great latch and things were going smoothly with breast feeding offered it because my daughter was extremely fussy colicky would have given her anything that had chance to soothe her poor little thing tried it often and tried several different kinds she was just not into it she still wo take one she did just start sucking her finger thumb though and the fussiness colic has been gone for approx weeks good luck neither of my kids really took to pacifier we put it in their mouths and hold it there and as soon as we took our finger away it just fall out we really did try for the pacifier to work did want to deal with thumb sucking there was no problem with breast feeding bottle feeding and trying pacifier with my daughter we made it months before the boobs just gave up my son however he definitely had nipple confusion with the pacifier and bottle and breast feeding only lasted months because he was moose and my boobs just could keep up with how fast he grew talking doubling his weight by months we now have two lovely little thumb suckers lt 17 months really each baby is different on how they deal with it it what you can handle from your baby and how they react to your goals with breastfeeding disagree on this wholeheartedly babies forget toddlers do my good friend took her son plug away the same time she stopped breastfeeding when he was about one and he barely cared at all it was like he assumed it was another one of those things you give up once you start eating solids was sucker and let my daughter keep hers and trying to get her to let go of it was nightmare finally had to bribe her to give it up when she was potty trained and almost in preschool she has had an ear infection yet and she only had it at night so speech was never an issue but when taught young toddlers in daycare there was very clear difference in the vocabulary of the ones that did and did use pacifiers during the day would strongly reccomend weaning her off of it at the same time and the same pace as you wean her off of nursing it will save you lot of grief and about 10 on present from the binky fairy later on never really used pacifier and breast fed for year the only times ever really used one was those strawberry ones with the little bumps on it for teething and then he mostly just chewed on it and at night time when ever he woke up just nursed till he was done and when he was finished he was asleep and went back into his crib my month old is interested in them at all she is breast and bottle fed never wanted had to use them thankfully have friends who had terrible time weaning their little ones off pacifiers if you can would say avoid it but we all know that loss of sleep which makes pacifiers more tempting
